p: In this regard, Kulakiotu et al. [ 8] reported cell protoplast secretion without initial cell wall disruption in mycelial hyphae of B. cinerea exposed to volatiles of grape ( Vitis labrusca, cv. Isabella) resulting in cell wall deformation. Hyphae from the control treatment was healthy, possessing conidiophores with abundant conidia [ 8]. The mechanism of action of volatiles inhibiting hyphal growth and their effect on membranes needs further investigation. Thymol and carvacrol also showed antimicrobial activity against natural grape yeasts in red wines via damage to the membrane, leakage of cytoplasmic content and finally inhibition of erogosterol biosynthesis [ 39].
